channel.title: Local Media on CAMGDP: Central Asia and Mongolia Gender Data Portal
channel.description: Recent content in Local Media on CAMGDP: Central Asia and Mongolia Gender Data Portal

item.title: Against Frotterizm
item.description: Founded in 2021, Against Frotterizm is a social campaign project based on voluntary involved. It is combating frotteurism and harassment of women in Uzbekistan’s public transport. The project aims to increase public awareness of the issue, develop mechanisms to detect cases of harassment in public transport, and develop instructions on what to do and how to protect victims if they are harassed on public transport.

item.title: Daryo
item.description: Launched in 2015, Daryo is a digital news media offering coverage of politics, economics, sport, and culture in Uzbekistan and around the world.

item.title: Kok.team
item.description: Founded in 2017 and dissolved in 2022, Kok.team was a grassroots LGBT organization dedicated to providing information on the LGBT issues in Kazakh. Digital archive contains articles, podcasts and videos of Kazakhstani LGBT  community. Available in Kazakh and Russian with occasional translation to English.

item.title: Qalampir
item.description: Launched in 2015, Qalampir is a digital news and analytics publication with an aim to achieve transparent and quality informational space in the media sector of Uzbekistan.

item.title: Repost
item.description: Launched in 2017, Repost is a Russian-language news media in Uzbekistan. It covers local and world affairs, as well as lifestyle and cultural events.

item.title: Sof.uz
item.description: Launched in 2016, Sof.uz is a digital news publication designed to deliver news to a wider audience using accessible language.

item.title: Spot
item.description: Launched in 2017 as a part of the Afisha Media company, Spot is a news media primarily covering business and economic news in Uzbekistan. It also offers editorial pieces on the same topics.

item.title: Uzbek Review
item.description: Uzbek Review is a news agency founded by Europe-Uzbekistan Association for Economic Cooperation (EUROUZ). It regularly publishes market reports and occasional analytical pieces.

item.title: Uzbekistan Daily
item.description: Launched in 2009, Uzbekistan Daily (UzDaily) is a digital news media with a focus on business and occasional coverage of other Central Asian countries.

item.title: UzReport
item.description: Launched in 1999, UzReport is one of the largest news portals in Uzbekistan. It offers coverage of politics, economics, culture, and sports, as well as analytical and interview pieces.

item.title: Anhor
item.description: Anhor is an independent media that positions itself as a platform for “analytics, investigations, and news.” The publication’s mission is to contribute to effective governing.

item.title: Art - Review
item.description: Art - Review is local media about art and culture in Uzbekistan. It has presence on Instagram, Telegram, and Facebook.

item.title: Ayol buyum emas
item.description: Ayol buyum emas is a nascent social project aimed at supporting Uzbek women and combating violence against them. It also has presence in Telegram.

item.title: Ayt Community
item.description: Ayt Community is a local media with a focus on feminism, legislature, and ethics. Ayt Community also organizes various events and advocates for an inclusive future for women.

item.title: Center for the Development of Contemporary Journalism in the Republic of Uzbekistan
item.description: Center for the Development of Contemporary Journalism in the Republic of Uzbekistan is an nongovernmental and noncommercial media institution aimed at improving the quality of journalism in Uzbekistan through “identifying problem areas, education, creating quality content that meets the highest standards of truthfulness and objectivity.” The center offers trainings for journalists, bloggers, and mass communication professionals, as well as workshops for a wider audience on media literacy.

item.title: Exponaut
item.description: Exponaut is an independent media geared toward a younger audience. It covers art and culture, as well as creating projects meant to spotlight women and LGBTQIA+ community of Uzbekistan. Exponaut also has presence on Telegram.

item.title: Kun.Uz
item.description: Launched in 2012, Kun.Uz is an online publication platform with a wide presence across social media platforms. It offers coverage of news events in Uzbekistan and across the world. The publication works in cooperation with the state and public organizations operating on the territory of Uzbekistan.

item.title: Manarifat
item.description: Manarifat is a social media initiative dedicated to matters of sexual and reproductive health of women. It offers educational content on often stigmatized topics related to sexuality.

item.title: Sarpa
item.description: Sarpa is independent Uzbek media with a focus on human rights, democracy, and gender equality.

item.title: Sening mening haqqimiz
item.description: Sening mening haqqimiz is a social media account advocating for women’s rights, education, and development in Uzbekistan. On its Instagram page, sening mening haqqimiz shares relevant resources and news. The initiative is particularly focused on issues of violence against women.

item.title: Uzbekistan with a Female Voice
item.description: Uzbekistan with a Female Voice is a social media initiative that advocates for gender equality and women empowerment in Uzbekistan by spotlighting stories of Uzbek women and sharing relevant events and news. It has presence on Facebook and Telegram.

item.title: Hook Report
item.description: Founded in 2018, Hook Report is an independent Uzbek media offering coverage of political, economic, art, and cultural news in the country. According to its mission, Hook Report aims to bring quality news coverage using a less traditional and formal approach.

item.title: Vlast
item.description: Founded in 2012, Vlast offers coverage of current events in Kazakhstan, as well as various editorial projects.

item.title: Azattyq
item.description: Azattyq is a Kazakhstani branch of Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, a US Congress-funded broadcasting organization. Offers coverage of current events in Kazakhstan, as well as various editorial projects.

item.title: Batyr Jamal
item.description: Founded in 2021, Batyr Jamal is a women-oriented media with coverage primarily focusing on women’s rights, safety, and self-worth. Available on Instagram and Telegram.

item.title: Factcheck.kz
item.description: Founded in 2017, Factcheck.kz is a publication focuses on fact checking news and viral media. Available on Instagram, Telegram, TikTok, and YouTube.

item.title: HolaNews
item.description: Founded in 2012, HolaNews offers coverage of current events in Kazakhstan on Instagram, Facebook, and Telegram.

item.title: Human Rights KZ
item.description: Founded in 2021, Human Rights KZ is dedicated to sharing domestic and international human rights information and news in Kazakh. Available on Instagram.

item.title: Manshuq
item.description: Manshuq is a women-oriented media with coverage primarily focusing on lifestyle, culture, career, and other editorial projects.

item.title: Masa Media
item.description: Founded in 2021, Masa Media strives to explain political, legal, and legislative systems in Kazakhstan.

item.title: Ratel
item.description: Founded in 2013, Ratel offers coverage of current events, opinion pieces, and journalistic investigations in Kazakhstan, specifically concerning corruption. The publication had its license rescinded in 2018 in a court ruling on the grounds of spreading misinformation due to the published investigations of various corruption cases. The site resumed its work in 2019. Available primarily in Russian with occasional publications in Kazakh and English.

item.title: Til Kespek Joq
item.description: Founded in 2020, Til Kespek Joq offers coverage of current events in Kazakhstan. Available in Kazakh on Instagram, Telegram, Twitter, Facebook, TikTok, and YouTube.

item.title: Village Kazakhstan
item.description: The Village Kazakhstan offers coverage of cultural and social life, events, and businesses.
